subanswer.text: Using Law of Cosines applied to right triangle ADM yields:\begin{align*}(\text{Length }CD)^2 &= (\text{Length}CM)^2 + (\text{Length}DM)^2 \\&= (11^2 + 10^2)-(\frac{1}{2}\times 11 \times 10)\cos(3\theta)\\&= 11^2+(10\sin 3\theta)^2\\&\approx  11^2+(\frac{2}{2})^2\\&= 121+25 \\&= 146.& \end{align*}Thus using Pythagorean Theorem again,\[\text{ Length }\;\; CD =\sqrt{146-\left(\frac{\sqrt{146}}{2}\right)^2} = \frac{\sqrt{292}}{\sqrt{2}} = 10\sqrt{2}.\][asy]
